title: Thunderbird bug
content:
When replying and using inline comments, any backspace gets turned into a carriage return at the end of the message. If you backspace over the first letter of your reply it throws you to the end of the message.

W10 machine, Thunderbird 140.4.0esr (32-bit)
creator: joepye

title: I have several email accounts that I use Thunderbird to manage, and in one of them, there is only the Inbox folder and the Drafts folder.
content: My gmail account in Thunderbird has only two folders, the Inbox and the Drafts folder. so when I delete a message, it lines out the message in the inbox with a single line strikeout and then in order to get it out of the Inbox I have to leave the Inbox and then when I come back to it the message is actually gone from the inbox. When I am using my laptop rather than my desktop computer, all of the folders are there and the messages, when deleted go to the "Trash" folder and are removed from the Inbox. I have been looking for a way to get all of those folders that are normally a part of the other accounts that I have on Thunderbird without success. Is there anyone here that knows how to restore those additional folders to the Gmail account that does not currently display them?
creator: tstory

title: Thunderbird not responding
content: I recently transferred my email account to The Messaging Company (big mistake I think) because my provider (Exetel) suggested them when they stopped hosting an email service. I then started having trouble receiving emails that I knew were sent and I thought that maybe my old emails were kept on the server too long and were taking up too much space on the server so I went into Thunderbird to change the settings to delete emails that had been on the server for 2 weeks. Thunderbird is now locked onto the Account Settings page and I can't get out of it. As soon as I click on the page I get the "Thunderbird not responding" message so I close the program. I've tried starting Thunderbird in safe mode with no result. I downloaded the latest version and reinstalled Thunderbird but as soon as I start the program it takes me straight into the "frozen" Account Settings page that I can't get out of. I have gone into The Profiles folder and I've included a screenshot of what's there. The latest profile was created when I tried to change the Account Settings. Can I delete that profile and go back to the one created on 9/6/2025?
creator: geoffreysmith

title: come modificare l'ordine di giorno e mese nella data
content: Buongiorno, Ho bisogno di modificare l'impostazione della data. Ora è nella formula statunitense, cioè mese poi giorno. Mentre necessito avere prima il giorno e poi il mese, ma non trovo come fare. Potete aiutarmi? Grazie e saluti, Barbara
creator: barbara.brugiapaglia

title: Thunderbird leaves a “ghost window” on macOS 26
content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve run into a weird issue with Thunderbird on macOS 26 (Tahoe) and I’m wondering if anyone else has seen this.

When I close the main Thunderbird window using Command + W or RedDot Close Button, the window disappears like normal, but something is still left behind. It’s like an invisible or “ghost” window stays on the screen. Because of that, I can’t click anything that was underneath the Thunderbird window. The area is still blocked as if the window never fully closed.

If I open Mission Control (F3), I can see an empty tile where the window should be, which confirms that something is still there even though it’s not visible.

A few details: • The problem happens every time I close the main window with Command + W • Thunderbird keeps running in the background, but I can’t bring the window back unless I quit the app completely • This only happens with Thunderbird, no other app on macOS 26 has this issue on my machines • On previous macOS versions I never had this problem

System info: • macOS 26 (Tahoe), fully updated • Latest stable Thunderbird release • Mac mini M4 and MacBook Air M4

It looks like some kind of window management bug on macOS 26, but only triggered by Thunderbird.

Has anyone else experienced this or knows if it’s a known issue? Thanks!
creator: kordian.net

title: Copying thousands of emails to local folders and to IMAP folders in Gmail
content:
I have have had a Gmail address for a few years and have just created a new Gmail address, I am trying to copy about 20,000 emails from the original Gmail IMAP folders to local Thunderbird folders as a backup, and then copy them to the new Gmail address IMAP folders.

I have tried copying these in smaller amounts as suggested (between 200 and 500 at once) This seems to go well, however, when I have completed the task the original folder has a much higher amount of messages in it than the new one, so some messages are being lost along the way.

Is there a reliable method to do this, such as closing Thunderbird and then copying and pasting data held in the profile folder, or does it need to be done with Thunderbird running?

Many Thanks in advance
creator: dawson.thirteen

title: How to edit mail rules

Can someone help me with where I can find the rules and edit them?
